content.description:
This tackles a prominent offwidth crack around and right from

Gypsy Fortune

.
content.location:
Around and right from

Gypsy Fortune

.

content.description: This is a very short, steep 3 bolt gymnastic face climb ending on Josh's inevitable loose grain.  It starts at a right leaning rail and pops up to huge jugs.  Move up past the third bolt (crux) then up and right.
content.protection: 3 nice fat button head bolts, all spinners for protection.  One great bolt for the anchor, 0.5-1" cams to back it up.  Easy fifth class scramble right or rappel off the single bolt to get down.
content.location: North face of the big top, about 100 feet west of 3 Ring Circus.

climbs.name: Sawdust and Peanut Shells
climbs.fa: (TR) Mark Maynard, Nov. 1988, First lead: Louie Anderson and David Larson, April 1989

content.description:
Takes a line just right of center with a crux down low and continuous friction and edges above.

Seems a bit contrived at the top since you can escape to easier terrain off right.
content.location:
This is the face just right of

Lion Tamer

.

content.description: Climbs a right leaning wishbone crack to a horizontal crack and then moves left onto the west face and up easy terrain to the top.
content.location: Located on the left side of the Big Top's south face.

content.description: This somewhat runout friction route climbs past two widely spaced bolts with a tricky move at the bottom and another just past the last bolt. Supplemental protection may be found with small wires to help lessen the runouts.
content.protection:
2 bolts (3/8"), shared anchors with

Sawdust and Peanut Shells
content.location:
Between

More My Speed

and

Sawdust and Peanut Shells

.

content.description: Climb a vertical dike system up the south face of a small pillar. Could be treated as a highball boulder problem as well.
content.protection: TR from one bolt on top
content.location: Down and right from the main face of the big top on a small pillar.

content.description: Climbs a dike on the E. Face of the largest formation west of Indian Cove Group Camp Ground Road. Route faces east. As you hike west, this formation is the large formation to the NW, a few bolts at the start, some natural gear, to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: A few smallish cams, plus QDs for the bolts. Anchor to rap off
content.location: This is the largest rock formation west of The Big Top.

content.description: This is a nice 5 bolt face/friction climb on the north side's longest face.  The moves are pretty good and consistent.  The guide books rate this climb 5.10c, but it felt easier than Sawdust and Peanut Shells to me after leading both.
content.protection: Five good bolts with old hangers provide good protection.  The fourth bolt has no hanger or nut, a small wired stopper could be used on the stud adequately.  A two bolt anchor at the top with ratty slings for the belay/rappel.
